content.introduction:
The check finds usages of 
sizeof
 on expressions of STL container types.
Most likely the user wanted to use 
.size()
 instead.

All class/struct types declared in namespace 
std::
 having a const

size()
 method are considered containers, with the exception of

std::bitset
 and 
std::array
.

Examples:

std
::
string
 
s
;


int
 
a
 
=
 
47
 
+
 
sizeof
(
s
);
 
// warning: sizeof() doesn't return the size of the container. Did you mean .size()?



int
 
b
 
=
 
sizeof
(
std
::
string
);
 
// no warning, probably intended.



std
::
string
 
array_of_strings
[
10
];


int
 
c
 
=
 
sizeof
(
array_of_strings
)
 
/
 
sizeof
(
array_of_strings
[
0
]);
 
// no warning, definitely intended.



std
::
array
<
int
,
 
3
>
 
std_array
;


int
 
d
 
=
 
sizeof
(
std_array
);
 
// no warning, probably intended.
